title: UTF-8General Punctuation

metadata.description: Learn about UTF-8General Punctuation with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Hex 2000-206F / Decimal 8192-8303 If you want any of these characters displayed in HTML, you can use the HTML entity found in the table below. If the character does not have an HTML entity, you can use the decimal (dec) or hexadecimal (hex) reference. Example

I will display ‰

I will display ‰

I will display ‰

summary: This tutorial covers UTF-8General Punctuation concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use UTF-8General Punctuation effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of UTF-8General Punctuation and how to apply it in your projects.
